resources.string: QUIZ\: The Six Wive Of HenryVIII
What country was Henry VIII the King of?
Henry\'s first wife was Catherine of Aragon. Where was Aragon?
Anne Boleyn was Henry\'s second wife. Who was their famous daughter?
Queen Elizabeth I
Queen Mary (otherwise known as Bloody Mary)
Henry\'s third wife was Jane Seymour. How did she die?
She was executed for adultery
She died from complications of childbirth
Henry married Anne of Cleves in 1540. How did their marriage end?
She threw herself from the battlements of the Tower of London to avoid death at the hands of the executioner
The marriage was annulled and they remained friends
Henry married 19 year old Kathryn Howard when he was 39. She was executed less than two years later. Why?
She was accused of heresy and witchcraft
She was accused of fornication and adultery
check your score
France

6/7 \n Great job! You really know your history!
How much do you know about the Six Wives of King Henry VIII? Ready? Let\'s Play!
Try again
Mary, Queen of Scots
Lady Jane Grey
Henry had her killed because he wanted sons and she bore only daughters
She died of the plague
Henry sent her back to her father in Germany when he found out that she wasn\'t a virgin. He kept her dowry
She died in childbirth
She attempted to escape to France with her lover
He grew tired of her
Katherine Parr was the last wife of Henry VIII. How did she escape the fate of her predecessors?
He really liked her cooking
She ran away to Spain under the protection of her uncle, the King
She finally bore him the son he had always wanted
She outlived him
7/7 Perfect Score! You are the history champ
5/7 Nice try. Thanks for playing
Less than 5/7 Too bad, not everyone can be good at history
